1.text: Pulse the ice in a blender until crushed.

3.text: Pour the lemonade into the blender and blend until everything is mixed together, or until you get a consistency you like.

4.text: Taste the frozen lemonade and make any necessary adjustments.

5.text: Pour the frozen lemonade into several tall glasses.

7.text: Place a 9 by 12 inch (22.86 by 30.48 centimeters) baking pan into the freezer 30 minutes before you start making the lemonade.

8.text: Combine the sugar, lemon juice, and 2 cups (475 milliliters) of water in a pitcher.

9.text: Pour the lemonade into the pan, and freeze it for 90 minutes, stirring it every half hour.

10.text: Whisk in the remaining 1 cup (240 milliliters) of water, and give the lemonade a taste.

11.text: Pour the frozen lemonade into a blender, and blend until smooth.

12.text: Pour the frozen lemonade into tall glasses, and serve.

13.text: Combine the lemon juice, sugar, and water in a pitcher, and stir until the sugar is dissolved.

14.text: Leave the lemonade in the refrigerator for 1 hour to chill.

15.text: Add 1 cup (240 milliliters) of the chilled lemonade and 4 scoops of ice cream into a blender.

16.text: Blend the lemonade and ice cream together until completely smooth.

17.text: Pour the frozen lemonade into 2 tall glasses and serve.
